page.title: 04POLLOK HOUSE/MUSEUM GLASGOW
page.content: Pollok House is situated 3/4 of a mile from the Pollokshaws Road entrance of Pollok Country Park. The house dates from l752 and its design may have been influenced by the Scottish architects Wm. and John Adam. The outside of the house, a rather austere appearance, contrasts sharply with the lavish interior decoration. Perhaps the most famous of all the collections within the house is the Stirling Maxwell Collection of paintings, which includes works by El Greco, Goya, Murilla and the British artist, Wm Blake. Also worth mentioning is the tea room in the house - a restored Edwardian kitchen and its most striking feature is a 3O ft cast iron range complete with water driven spit.
